task_summary: Perceive the T-block, approach and align the circular tool, push the block toward its target zone, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style arm with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block across a flat white table until it reaches a fixed goal region. The behavior emphasizes perception of the block, safe approach above it, alignment of the tool orientation, and a single controlled push along a chosen direction. Timing is modest and compatible with 10 Hz control/observation. After motion, the robot retreats to clear the area. Visual evidence shows approach, contact, sustained pushing, and final disengagement.
preconditions: Workspace clear except for the T-block and table
No grasp required; pure pushing with circular tool
stepwise_plan: If the T-block is not already visible, actively detect it.
Move above the T-block to a safe height.
Approach and align the tool to the block.
Set tool yaw for a straight push.
Execute a push of fixed distance toward the target.
Retreat to a standby position and wait briefly.
success_criteria: T-block translated in the intended direction by the required distance
No loss of contact stability during push
End-effector safely clears the object after the push
failure_and_recovery: Perception failure → retry DetectObject up to 3 attempts
Insufficient displacement → re-align and repeat push
Unexpected contact force → abort push and retreat, then re-detect
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when push completes and the arm has retreated and waited briefly.

frame_3.now_evidence: Tool aligned over the stem of the T with imminent contact.
frame_3.predicts_next: Strong indicator that a forward push will occur next.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Checks if the T-block is visible.
Detects the T-block if not already visible.
Moves to a safe height above the block.
Refines pose to align tool for pushing.
Sets tool yaw to push with a side contact.
Backs off from the object after pushing.

failure_modes: Push distance insufficient due to friction
recovery_strategy: Re-approach and realign before another push
Abort and retreat on abnormal contact, then re-detect
assumptions: Frames show a red T-block and dark tool, while instruction mentions gray/blue—color mismatch noted; geometry matches.
Exact target zone not visible; push direction set symbolically to 0°.
Single straight push (0.2 m) presumed sufficient for this episode.

expected_success_criteria: Block visibly translated in consistent direction
